comments:
I believe this was due to bad code in the 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.launcher.JavaElementPropertyTester.isApplet 
method:
	private boolean isApplet(IJavaElement element) {
        try {
            IType type = getType(element);
            IType[] allSuperTypes = JavaModelUtil.getAllSuperTypes(type, new 
NullProgressMonitor());
            for (int i = 0; i < allSuperTypes.length; i++) {
                IType superType = allSuperTypes[i];
                if (superType.getFullyQualifiedName().equals
("java.applet.Applet")) { //$NON-NLS-1$
                    return true;
                }
            }
        } catch (JavaModelException e) {
        }
        return false;
	}

The call to getType will (reasonably) return null if the element passed in is 
an IPackageDeclaration or an IImportDeclaration.  The isApplet method passes 
this null to getAllSuperTypes and the NPE quickly ensues.  The isApplet method 
should check for this null and return false.

To reproduce this turn the package or import declaration filters off in the 
navigator and bring up the popup menu on a package or import declaration.  
Then try to follow the Run As or Debug As cascade menus.  At this point no 
cascade appears and if you then dismiss the popup, you will find the exception 
in the Error Log view.

Here is the full exception...
